column4: hi folks, does the command "cat file.iso > /dev/my-usb" generates a bootable usb stick?
that won't work, you'll have to use something like dd. A quick google search should show you how to do it
ok, thanks, can you point me?

I googled this, it's from Arch but it's largely distribution-agnostic. Just pay attention to the documentation. You only need the 'Overwrite the USB drive' section https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/USB_Installation_Media
